newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends flat, dollar supplies tight.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends flat, dollar supplies tight.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed flat on Wednesday following a squeeze on the supply of U.S. dollars for a second straight session, dealers said.
The local currency ended at 43.7540/7560 to the dollar after being quoted in a wide range of 43.7500/7700 per dollar in early trade. Deals mostly centred at 43.7550.
But dealers said the central bank sold dollars to importers, restraining the U.S. currency's gains against the local currency.
Call money was unchanged from the previous rate of 5.0-5.5 percent.
